title: You and Me in a City
des: You And Me in a City English, Canada, 10min, 2015 What we seek is not always found where we seek it. Especially when were not exactly honest about what it is we are looking for to begin with. 'You & Me in a City' is a Canadian short film that explores the non-narrated longing and loneliness that comes from being in a city that is not ours. Often described as 'could've been a love story', the main characters discover their expectations and hopes as they spend time with their friends in their city. The 'non-dit' theme of the film allows the audience to interpret their own meaning and leaves them pondering on the future of these characters as the credits begin to roll.

Things get more complicated, however, when Jack meets a girl named Z (Amanda Musolino) at the local bookstore and immediately falls for her. title: Fading Away
des: Fading Away showcases a series of never before told stories from a group of unique Korean War veterans and refugees through a series of insightful interviews and the use of rare historical film footage, photos and other archival material. These veterans and survivors share their stories in their own words with their sons, daughters and grandchildren with memories of catastrophe, fear, and the pains they vividly remember. The film is divided into seven parts, strung together and led by the powerful recollection of the journey of a 13 year-old Korean War orphan who fled the North to the South as he recalls his memories and emotions of the war. The film also showcases a love story of an American couple who met during the Korean War, as well as the unique perspective of several female soldiers who for the first time ever now share their humorous and very personal emotional moments during the war and its impact on their lives today.

title: Catch of a Lifetime
des: Elaine Rose Chalmers has the perfect organized life. The host of her own Austin, Texas radio program, the self-proclaimed "Queen of Planning" spends her days advising callers on how charts, lists, and graphs can insure a peaceful, successful life and what results they can expect. But, what she doesn't expect is the result of one very disorganized evening back home in the little town of McIntosh, Florida. It seems that one recent "very hard to remember evening" with Billy Joe Crawley, her high school sweetheart, has changed a few things on Elaine's list. And now... she's unexpectedly expecting! A baby hadn't made her 2-year plan; she'd barely penciled it in at the bottom of the 5-yr goal sheet. And a one-night stand with a childhood friend hadn't exactly been on her to-do list, either! Join Elaine, Billy Joe and a host of city people and bunch of good olé southern folk as we watch how they deal with the one thing we all know is guaranteed in this life - change! Now it seems that for Elaine Rose Chalmers, host of Austin's #1 radio show "Charmed with Chalmers", an unexpected pregnancy forces her to learn that sometimes the best plan is not having a plan at all.

title: One Night In Mexico
des: One story, one script, one cast, one location, two languages. We shot this film twice, one take in English second take in Spanish so we ended up with a unique film experience, just pick a language. A love story that crosses borders. This film has been dedicated tot he 'Dreamers' in the US, that feel in between cultures and countries. Pablo is a first generation Mexican/American born in the United States, his parents gave him a great education and family life as they assimilated into the American lifestyle. His parents planned on returning to Mexico to retire but after the death of Pablo's mother their dream of returning to their beloved country died with her. Pablo's father vowed to show Pablo the roots of his heritage and sends his son to Mexico to their family's Tequila factory in hopes he will understand and appreciate his heritage. Little did he know that "One Night in Mexico" would change his son's life forever. Starring Alex Reymundo, Monika Munoz and special appearances by Hugo Stigliz. 'One Night In Mexico' will change your perspective across the border.
cast: Hugo Stiglitz, Alex Reymundo, Monika Munoz, Gabriela Reynoso

Women Doors Fanclub Sleepover Meeting. title: Moving into the Infinite
des: Artistic Documentary Film Essay Moving into the Infinite: A contemporary fairytale told in essay form that documents the life of an extraordinary dancer. In her worldwide travels, she encounters people from different countries, cultures, religions, and social statuses, each with a different life story. In the collective story of these encounters, the film invites us to reflect upon our own values and assumptions. Touching on symbols and archetypes, Moving into the Infinite traces the soul's quest and journey. A dance film and cosmic love story, it is about the desire for Truth in the guise of dance.

title: The First Promise

title: Last of Our Kind
des: Weaving together film, music and poetry, "Last of Our Kind" transforms the memory of a lost love into a ritualistic incantation of longing. Action is exaggerated and time seems to blur, as the lovers' tale unfolds poetically into a modern interpretation of the Persephone myth. Shot entirely on Super-8 - the movie traces the poem, line by line, throughout the city of Seattle in sequences of time-lapse photography blended with live-action that collapse and rearrange time and events into memories. Shot as a silent film, "Last of Our Kind" features an original soundtrack created by Robin Guthrie interwoven with a voiceover recitation of Rick Linville's poem.

When she comes across a charming old couch in a second-hand furniture shop, it sets her off on a fantastic train of thought about the strange and wonderful things she may experience with this couch in her life... until real life gives her a rather rude awakening.

title: Love & Distortion: A Genuine Search For A Mostly Real America
des: In 2016, while the country reels from a seemingly unstoppable vortex of disorientation, musicians & lifelong soulmates, The Grahams, set out on a spectacular motorcycle expedition across America's time warped RT 66. Amidst the neon, the romance, the heat, the music and the sheer power of nostalgia The Grahams explore the concept of "real" America with the eccentric and notorious characters who live and work in the strange world that is Route 66. Featuring a surreal soundtrack with contributions from Nashville's finest; Elizabeth Cook, Aaron Lee Tasjan, Dylan Leblanc, Chuck Mead, The Grahams, Kevin Kinney, Andrew Combs, Lilly Hiatt and many more, Love & Distortion is not a travel guide or a musical biopic. This feature length documentary, which follows The Grahams down the Mother Road, is an unconventional narrative weaving in and out of moments and realities that can be found in the various sub-cultures of America's Main Street.

Isabelle and Will drive to a park, leave the car and have sex. The father follows in his car, but falls into a delirium again. Sometimes comedic, sometimes sad, always soulful, Sequence sets out to explore those small pieces of life that usually go unnoticed but make all the difference in the world.

des: A quiet and painfully shy sophomore, Nate Carson is forced into artistic servitude by his overbearing half-sister, Heather. He is resigned to social invisibility until he meets Logan, an attractive and charming upperclassman. Enchanted by Logan's kind deeds, Nate begins folding paper hearts as a way of expressing his feelings. With the help of a new Wizard of Oz-obsessed friend, Nate develops the courage to finally stand up to his sister and break free. But Heather discovers the hearts, and isn't going down without a fight.

title: Absolutely Positive
des: Absolutely Positive is a dramatic short film that follows four characters, all from different walks of life, as they get tested for HIV. It shows the events of why they decide to get tested, the thoughts that run through their minds as they wait for their results, and how they decide to live their lives after discovering their results. Displaying a truthful insight into the many worlds and faces of HIV, Absolutely Positive sheds light on the importance of personal accountability as well as lack of discrimination, showing that HIV has no limits and knows no bounds. It only takes one person and only one time.
cast: Jenny Austin, Tavis L. Baker, Steve Bearden, Jodi Burgess

title: Love.Life
des: "Love.Life" is a gay-themed dramedy about six friends on a journey to discover the meanings of love and life. What defines love? And what happens when life gets in the way? "Love.Life" takes us on a journey through the eyes and writings of writer-blogger Jamie Rolland and his five closest friends. Here, we experience the very deep connections this group of friends has, as well as the emotions connected with self discovery. Rooted in West Hollywood and Los Angeles, we learn of Jamie, A.J., Jason, Kyle, Mikey, and Amy's struggles and triumphs.... whether it be their careers, friendships, relationships, or the pressures of every day life. Welcome to "Love.Life".

title: Recessive

She struggles with her desire to be genetically connected to her own child--and with the knowledge that she may carry the marker for a serious genetic disorder. As Shay and Norah head off to the family home for the funeral of Shay's aunt, they must grapple with the nature of family, legacy, and parenthood. Recessive weaves experimental and personal documentary elements artfully into subtle acting to create a very modern, deeply emotional, narrative film.

The son, along with the help of kooky family and friends, are then faced with the challenge of telling his father of the divorce and rescuing the restaurant. In the midst of this chaos, seeing his mother truly in love puts his feelings for his current girlfriend in question and instead draws the interest of a local woman. The father, retreats to the safe haven of his daughters home where he is forced to come to terms with his outdated and traditional ways while the restaurant and his marriage are all at risk of failing.

title: Before We Say Goodbye
des: Before We Say Goodbye" deals with four generations of an Hispanic-American family living in Albuquerque, New Mexico, from the crusty tequila-drinking great grandma to the rebellious all-American teenager who prefers Taco Bell to the food at her parents' Mexican restaurant. Carlos Garcia, beloved patriarch of his family, is dying. His adoring wife, Ramona, is in a state of denial. Ramona is sure the Virgin of Guadalupe will grant her a miracle and save Carlos, much to the skepticism of her family. Despite her devout faith, Ramona worries about how she will cope with her troubles and keep her family together if Carlos passes. Her four grown children are wrapped up in their own lives that are filled with problems that threaten to tear the family apart. Carlos has been the guiding force who has kept the family together, and as Carlos is declining, his wisdom and love bring light into their lives. But Carlos and Ramona are troubled that their children reject the cultural and religious heritage that means so much to them both. Sensing his end is near, Carlos announces that he has received a vision from Saint Francis, his patron saint. He convinces Ramona to travel to Mexico with her sister Lucia so they can make a pilgrimage to the Basilica of the Virgin of Guadalupe to appeal to the Virgin for his recovery. Ramona discovers that when we deeply love a someone, life will make the most difficult demands on us before we say goodbye.
cast: Juanita Sena-Shannon, F.X. Gurrola-Gal, Maria Elena Montoya, Diana Padilla

title: Broken Eternity
des: 'Broken Eternity' is a love story set in modern day London yet begins one hundred years ago in India. Much of the action unfolds without words; the only real dialog is a sequence that takes place ten years ago between the main characters, SARALA and her father CHANDRAN. It is a conversation between little SARALA and CHANDRAN that becomes the vehicle for our understanding of theme of reincarnation and how it relates to SARALA's dream. It helps thread three strands together: childhood, present day and dream/past, layering images and moments to create an impressionistic film. It also acts, at times, as a voice-over, showing us that SARALA believes she is the woman in the dream, the woman in the past.
cast: Aria Prasad, Ramon Tikaram, Jasmine Ram, Abhin Galeya

She has dinner with her parents then retires to her bedroom to take a nap before heading off to work at a seedy laundromat across town. The laundromat takes on a whole new presence after dark as Alice interacts with unique and colorful characters that come and go throughout the night. Dirty Laundry is revealed but are the visions she sees all just a dream.

Since India is the home to 40 percent of the world's marriages, of which 90 percent of these are arranged, 'The Great Indian Marriage Bazaar' is a film told through the Directors' lens about issues of morality, sexuality, beauty and femininity and most identity of cosmopolitan Indian women today.

title: Prime Time
des: Two different families, one husband and father. Family Bander lives in Vienna and there are 3 sons. Family Bander lives in Pannonhalma, Hungary, and there is one daughter. Markus Bander alias Talker unexpectedly dies of a heart attack while having breakfast in a coffee shop and his double existence has been revealed. At his funeral both widows and the kids get to know each other for the first time. The two women become best friends and create a wonderful patchwork-family. A year after Markus' death Livia quit her job as lector and holds flirt seminars for men. Milly is a shrink and starts working on her book about "Silent men". Her daughter Pippa finishes her Sociology- studies . Livia's eldest son moved to Japan, the middle one is a musician and the youngest still goes to school. Livia and Milly are still looking for Mr. Right and fall in love with two men. These affairs end in absolute disaster. Nevertheless they believe in love and don't give up finding the right man.

title: Hold on Tight
des: Holding hands or kissing in public isn't for everyone. When it comes to same sex relationships, showing your love outside of the home is sometimes a complicated personal choice. This short documentary moves between the public and private spaces in which lesbian and gay couples live, and explores small gestures of human connectedness. These gentle interactions not only carry a huge personal significance, but also the potent power to create social change. Yet, for most people, being affectionate beyond the hall door isn't intended as a political statement - it's an expression of love.

title: Doritos: 7 Minutes in Cheesy Heaven
des: At a house party, pretty girl Samantha is picked to be kissed during a game of 7 Minutes In Heaven, and all of the boys badly hope the spinning bottle will choose them. The bottle stops and points to socially awkward Tim, who nervously enters the bathroom where she is waiting for him. Puckering his lips in the dark, Tim hears a crunching noise. Long after the timer has stopped, the group grows impatient, and everyone approaches the room. They find Tim and Samantha holding each other on the floor, surrounded by Doritos, blissfully munching the same chip between their lips. Screen flashes: "DORITOS. For the bold."

title: Remaining Days

But a premature end threatens their love, as he has to leave soon. They decide to pursue their relationship, planning to establish a life together in Germany. The film accompanies Josh during his last weeks in Uganda. Everyday situations show the pragmatic and optimistic attitude that defines his actions. The different cultural backgrounds don't seem to affect Josh and Racheal's interactions. It is the story of a young love at a stage of major plans and dreams.

She's now a single mother, soon to be engaged to an absentee businessman, while Nick plays house with her-- becoming a surprising father figure for her son. title: Until Death
des: Until Death is a surreal tale of love between Boman and Maria. Set in a remote Indian village in the 1950s, the story glorifies love as an absolute emotion that surpasses all limitations of distance, and time. The film focuses on the issue of societal values and norms of the bygone era when the the caste system was still prevalent strongly. Boman, a quirky young Parsi man, owns a watch shop in the small Indian village. It is love at first sight when Maria walks into his shop. What begins as awkward encounters, soon transforms into a deeper beautiful bond of love until one day when Maria's father comes to know of it. Her family leaves the town, never to return again. Boman returns home one evening to find a note from Maria explaining that she may never return. In his heart, Boman still holds on to his love for her. After 8 years, he returns once again to find a note hanging by his door; a note from Maria. The story narrated through Boman's perspective, shows the couple's relationship as expressed through their letters. And in spite of all the odds, their love still remains strong. Death, which is viewed as the ultimate end, only serves to bring them closer, to unify them as ONE!
cast: P P Gupta, Sonal Joshi, Divyeshu Sinha

Curiosity overcomes her, and she instinctively purchases it. Upon turning the device on, she is immediately whisked away into a virtual reality dream, where she is once again reunited with her beloved Ben. But how long can this fantasy last for? And what untold damages might it be inflicting on Eve's subconscious?...

title: Yesterday
des: Enchant in the moment, memories are flashing in front of the eyes. Nilofar and Maiwand are college students, they are in love with each other. Even though Nilofar is in love with Maiwand, she is against getting married to him due to their age gap. Maiwand is madly in love with Nilofar, he believes age shouldn't restrict anyone from falling in love, the only thing that matters is for two souls to be together. Maiwand's grandfather is supporting his love for Nilofar. His feral childish emotions annoy Nilofar. She resents at first, but gradually the she becomes his friends. Maybe, because of her loneliness and lack of confidence, she starts liking the young man, or perhaps the young man who has missed the motherly love feels secure with Nilofar, but in any event his grandfather is a hero in the eyes of Maiwand. He is a symbol of wisdom and astuteness in his thoughts. As the days pass their love becomes more mature, but they are badly teased by their classmates. The story goes to different phases to explain their emotions, until the graduation night. And then that worse incident happens at that night and they lose each other forever. Maybe yesterday was a better day for Maiwand, but yesterday will never comes back again.

title: Different Similarities
des: Chaya and Bingwen are university students in a newly-begun, cross-cultural relationship. Chaya is Jewish. She is tall, beautiful, intelligent, independent-minded and comes from a very affectionate, noisy and demonstrative family. Bingwen is short in stature, innocent-looking, insightful and self-determining. He is also close to his family but in a much more formal way. Chaya and Bingwen are very happy and comfortable with each other and because each is so proud of - and well-rooted in - their own culture, they see no difficulty in being in a relationship with someone from a different one. When the young couple meet each other's parents, Chaya and Bingwen make a concerted effort to highlight the similarities shared by their cultures. It is by bringing these similarities to light that the differences between the two cultures are spotlighted. Each set of parents are very accommodating and interested in meeting their child's new friend, yet their very actions to show acceptance of this relationship reveal some of the differences that the young couple had not considered. Different Similarities addresses the question of whether differences and similarities between cultures unite or divide a relationship.
cast: Jeanie Cloutier, Rob Gillespie, Henry Mah, Sabrina Prada

title: Imber's Left Hand
des: A document of this artist's courageous and sometimes darkly humorous response to a death sentence, a diagnosis of ALS. The film traces his life, his career, and his adaptations, switching from painting from his right hand to his left, and then to both hands held at his waist as the degenerative condition progresses. Adversity only makes him more determined to paint, and paint he does: more than 100 portraits in a four month span. We first encounter Imber in his studio for the first time painting with his left hand while he and his partner, painter Jill Hoy, analyze Jon's self-portrait and talk about the anxiety to come. The painting becomes an unsettling metaphor of his psychological journey living into his dying through his art.
cast: Jill Hoy, Jon Imber, John Stomberg, Deborah Wye

title: Jinx

After a brief argument with Ola, Simon decides to venture outside, only to run into his old high school friend Matt. Bringing up distant memories, they both announce the same word at once mid-conversation. Matt jinxes Simon, forbidding Simon to speak until someone utters his name. For the rest of the day, Simon struggles to make his way without words.

title: Yabanci
des: Haymo (Mehmet Dundar) or Ishak, in his real name, is a political refugee who has tried returnless journeys since his childhood with the feeling of inadequacy in his existence and lived the last 20 years as a stateless in Eastern Europe. With his two friends he sought refuge in the Lavrion Refugee camp on the other side of the border by swimming the Meric River from Turkey to Greece. He works in orange and tobacco gardens with friends during his days at the camp and begins a long, quiet love life with Albanian refugee Eleni (Anastasya Yildiz), with whom he arrived the camp in the same truck. His path passes through his country once again after many years. He meets Safak (Gokben Dervis) who is an idle young girl living in a kortejoda (a house where the Jews live together) of a older neighborhood of Izmir with her mother and her brother. She has a forbidden relationship with Haymo's blind brother, Avaz (Bekir Anniak). Her indifference to taboos and bans brings her closer to Haymo and with this intimacy a new adventure will begin in her life.
cast: Mehmet Dündar, Gökben Dervis, Bekir Anniak, Sebnem Dogruer

title: Maybe Dreams Can Come True
des: A documentary/narrative film exploring the complex lives of expatriates. The main catalyst (Chocolat) is a young American performer torn between nurturing her love relationship in the USA, while maintaining a booming entertainment career in Europe. The plot evolves into a documentary medium, when Chocolat uses a small video camera as a tool to explore and question her life through interviewing others. Her questions include, why are her friends abroad? And do they intend to return to their native countries? We discover some of the common elements that drew them from their homes: economics, political climates, sexual freedom, and much more. The camera captures amazing performance art lifestyles in the backdrop of all interviews.

title: An Artist, The Studio, and All the Rest
des: An Artist, The Studio, and all the rest, is a two part HD film. Part I, is presented to the viewer as a form of performative research, shot in the studio of the Irish Artist, Thomas Ryan (b.1929) & The Royal Hibernian Academy, Dublin. Part II, is an appropriation & staging of the French Realist painting, The Artists Studio, by Gustav Courbet, 1854/55. Filmed at IMMA, The Great Hall, Dublin, where representatives & individuals from various levels of the arts, social classes, & politics, were invited to be filmed in the context of this surreal, staged studio. A representation of the power structures & the social-political space of the studio. Here, Thomas Ryan, central, plays the role of Courbet.

title: The Moment You Realize
des: Suicide among LGBT youth is extremely prominent in our current society, with suicide rates on the rise. This short film centres around the attempted suicide of the character Heath who is sent to the hospital for a psychological evaluation and must face his biggest challenge. Coming to terms with his sexuality. This short film depicts how the LGBT community and its youth continually struggle for acceptance and tolerance within the context of sexual awareness. Knowing oneself and staying true to who you are is the running theme of this film. Understanding that love should never be questioned but cherished and admired. We hope that this short film brings awareness and education for the LGBT youth who feel so ostracized that suicide becomes there only escape.
cast: Matthew Fuller, David Michael Moote, Becca Schreiber

title: The Marriage of the Thames and the Rhine
des: A hand drawn animation, it is an investigation into the historical and geographical relationship between Germany and England. Central characters in the narrative are Hermes, in the form of a seal, and Pegasus the mythological horse, both bearing witness to the voyage of the imagination, unhindered by the straight jacket of history and time. The animation has a dual meaning; it is both symbolic meditation on a journey into the unknown through the eyes of Pegasus and the seal, both hoping to heal wounds and create a sense of unity in their universe and also an exploration of the geographical history of the Thames and Rhine, which 10,000 years ago formed one single river.

title: Meet Me on Saturday in...
des: A six part mini-series written by Michael J. Wood-Wilson: Meet Me on Saturday in... Kentish Town, London (Episode 1) Camden Town, London (Episode 2) Lewisham, London (Episode 3) Blackheath, London (Episode 4) Greenwich, London (Episode 5) Richmond, London (Episode 6) 'Meet Me on Saturday in...' is a contemporary love story with traditional themes, involving a young man from north London, Ben, and a young woman from south London, Amy. Each short episode is set in a different part of London that has featured strongly in their lives at some point. The mini-series is also part-autobiographical and an expression of the director's love of these six London districts, and more widely for London itself. After each episode Ben or Amy's 30 second voiceover briefly explains the district's origins and the reason for its name - three places are Ben's favourites, three are Amy's.

title: The Time We're In
des: Gabriel and Nadia's life was seemingly perfect up until the horrific news of her recent cancer diagnosis. As the stark realization takes hold of the two, they discover that there is no chance of having a family of their own. Their friends unsuccessfully try to relate to their condition and attempt to console the two, but sadly only connect in the most superficial way. They both feel they have to be strong for each other, but fear the unknown and dare not communicate their innermost fears. Nadia is cautiously optimistic toward her diagnosis but not without her own anxieties. She sees Gabriel withdraw into his newly introspective world and is concerned about his mental state. As the story unfolds, we learn of Gabriel's newly found obsession with the multi-verse theory, quantum physics, and the metaphysical, all culminate toward an unexpected reality: he discovers the ability to move freely throughout a stopped-time environment. He soon resigns himself to living almost exclusively in this isolated existence, believing that Nadia's tragic diagnosis cannot deteriorate any further. He sets out on journey to save Nadia at any cost. The Time We're In is based on my last two years coping with mom, dad, and wife all getting diagnosed with cancer. It's a fictionalized account rooted in our real-life ongoing drama, whereas the story's narrative explores topics of obsession, grief, and loss within a science fiction genre.
cast: Mike Falkow, Mary Thornton, Brian Graham, Bridgett Newton

Scarlet is clearly overwhelmed with her own struggles to pass school, be a compassionate fiancé and prepare for motherhood while Julian comes to terms with giving up his ideal career. Resentment builds between the couple leading to a huge dispute that could be the end of them. Their lives pass them by so quickly they forget to be thankful for each second they share together. Creativity embodies that life journey of human is originally set by the creator. Although the human illness and death are both within the planning program, selfless help can change the program. The main character of the film is a young dancer in Kuala Lumpur, who fell in love with a girl and accidently lost his life. But he did not know at all and became a wandering soul with amnesia. When he met LEMON, a pretty and dazzling neighbor of the God of death, he began to realize his real condition with her warning. After recovering his memory, he started to visit the world and search for answers to life.

As Rachel discovers the unpredictability of the world, she approaches her obstacles in the only way she knows how: with rules, logic, and the laws of reason. Will her meticulous plan work? Maybe not. It's a typical coming-of-age story, with a guy and girl out on their own for the first time, fending for themselves, figuring things out, coming to terms with their sexuality, making sense of God's silence, and making their first fumbling forays into romance. title: Adams Morgan: The Movie
des: Two pivotal days will impact the futures of three couples - one married, one just getting started, and one on the rocks - in this romantic comedy shot on location in Adams Morgan. Weaving together different story lines, ADAMS MORGAN: THE MOVIE brings to life the dynamism of Washington, DC through the various points of view of the men and women who live - and love - in Adams Morgan. Richard (Altorro Black), a hardworking father and husband, is bored. He's lost his mojo at his job, but is realizing it's part of a larger problem. His wife Shelby (Jenlene Nowak), emotionally and physically unfulfilled, wants nothing more than to renew their spark, but neither knows how or where to begin. Lance (Shaz Khan), a charming bartender, and Tonya (Blair Bowers), an ambitious career-girl, are young, beautiful, but full of problems. After nine months of dating, the feeling that they are on two distinct paths might force them to separate once and for all. Audrey (Sarah Taurchini), vulnerable from a recent break-up, meets John (Noah Baron), good-hearted but uncertain, at a Halloween party, where things progress quickly. It seems like a match made in heaven - until Audrey's former flame resurfaces, threatening the two from taking off. ADAMS MORGAN: THE MOVIE takes an insightful, witty and honest look at the issues facing couples at various points in their relationships, against the unique and dynamic backdrop of one of DC's most diverse and vibrant neighborhoods.
cast: Noah Baron, Altorro Prince Black, Blair Bowers, Paul Flippin

title: The Procession and the Bells

She doesn't have a full name. And certainly not a full life. L is part of the Department of Hygiene and Physical Culture's mandatory breeding initiative. Despite her feelings for a gifted, but flawed young man, she's to be contracted to a mate on their statistical likelihood of producing genetically-appropriate children. Filmed beautifully by Can Turkyilmaz and directed by Laura Carnes, The Procession And The Bells is a dystopic fairy tale that tangles with issues of self-determination, reproductive technology and man's desire to control our own uniquely-human nature.

Brad and Jessica begin to see each other secretly. Vanessa accidentally reads a text on Brad's phone from Jessica, and realizes she has been duped. She asks Ted to spy on the two of them and take a video. Ted agrees because he will do "anything for my best friend's girlfriend". Ted shows Vanessa the videotape and she is devastated. The moral of this story is that women who dump nice guys for muscular men can get hurt, because these men can be players, like in the case of Troy. In the dwarfs' attic, she discovers an altar for Satanic worship as well as Sleepy the Dwarf lusting for blood. title: Second Impressions

A short film centered around one unwittingly spontaneous event illuminating a young woman's struggles with learning to love herself and how her determination to get to the third date kick starts a new romance. A representative of the many women who don't think they are good enough, Nichole is bombarded with those irrepressible qualities which make her so beautiful and unique. And despite hilarious and disastrous attempts to ensure failure, and a losing race against time, she finally catches a glimpse of herself in the mirror that she starts to accept and will grow to love.
cast: Victor Cruz, Timothy Davis, Eva Gil, Christine Wheeler

title: Exposure
des: Exposure is about a guy and a girl with social anxiety disorder who get set up by their therapist to meet at a speed dating event.
cast: Josh Butcher, Angela de Silva, Michael Lawson, Christopher May

title: Biting
des: The internal worlds of two people create both the fear behind and reason for their falling in love.
cast: Zach Strum, Vera Casagrande

title: The Dispatcher
des: While working the graveyard shift, John, a rural police officer, engages in a phone-sex session with his dispatcher, Laurie. As things escalate, where does their routine end and abuse begin?
cast: Megan Corry, John William Larkin

title: A Bed Day
des: Two boyfriends who recently moved into together spend the entire day in bed.
cast: Peter Knegt, Luca Maria Piccolo

title: Just Married
des: Broken down, beaten and bankrupt, a married couple aims to leave town for a better opportunity only to find comfort and optimism in a peculiar source.
cast: Tommy Beardmore, Linda Bright Clay, James Krag

title: Boy Meets Girl
des: It's a warm summer day. A young woman is enjoying her free time, sitting on a bench and reading a book. Her peace is disturbed when a young man approaches her with apparently romantic intentions.
cast: Fabian Arthur Köll, Leonarda Lerch

title: Will
des: A love story about a College girl Sophie who suffer from depression met Will, a boy who seems to know her very well. And when she asks for the reason, Will claim that he is from the future to see her again. This led Sophie to wonder what is going to happen next if will isn't lying. This film play with the meaning of English word 'will', which stand for human mind, future, a boy's name, and a dead person's will.
cast: Avril Brady, Julia Eringer, Robert Heard, Colin Waitt

title: L.D.R.
des: With the help of their college roommates, two high school sweethearts in a long distance relationship have to decide how they want to spend the summer, and ultimately, whether they want to stay together.
cast: Lillia Nicole, Evan Chinn, Crystal Ho, Gavin Liang

title: Crossroads
des: Add a Plot
cast: Amelia Alvarez, Philip Andrew, Shahana Jan, Kian Kavousi

title: Hearts of Palm
des: When we learn to open up, great things can happen.
cast: Alexander Carroll, Tommy Germanovich Jr., Angela Gulner, Dan Lawler

title: Friends in Time
des: Ben travels across the country with his two best friends to find the girl he has been in love with since third grade. They are determined to help him find everyone else along the way.
cast: Brennan Gilroy, Tiffani Gainor, Thom Keller, Paul Yeates

title: Your Roommate
des: Two roommates are in love with the same man. Because of their finances, they cannot afford to move out.
cast: Arie Alexa, Sam Bailer, Harry Boynes, Shelly Christian

title: Unrequited
des: Jacques, a Haitian writer in Brooklyn, has to deal with an old flame who came back in his life unexpectedly.
cast: Shanna Bess, Pat Brown, Derya Celikkol, Kareem Green

title: Numb
des: Suffering from some dumb depression or whatever, Carrie loses the ability to feel. Anything. So she does the only logical thing anyone would do when they lack empathy, remorse or pain. She becomes a superhero.
cast: Mike Faerber, Nora Nagatani, Alicia V. Wilson

title: Sweet William
des: When it comes to time-travel you can't change the past. But you can learn from it.
cast: Jason Beaudoin, Xander France, Vic Michaelis, Tom Setterlund

title: My First Time
des: My First Time is a dramatic short about a mysterious girl named Jasmine's (Nicole Trunfio) on a first date with Alex (Victoria Haynes). Jasmine has always had the curiosity, but never had the courage to pursue her inner desires...until now. When she meets Alex an experienced suitor, Jasmine immediately falls for her charm. But once they are alone together, Jasmine's instincts come into play and their life is forever changed...
cast: Byrdie Bell, Victoria Haynes, Nicole Trunfio

title: Newman
des: Newman, a young man who was recently in a car accident finds himself suffering from memory loss. But he also starts to have very vivid dreams, all of them circulating around a particular girl. More to his confusion, Newman has a strange new affinity towards anything related to boats and the ocean. He feels out of control, defined by a past he can't fully remember, and driven by an obsession he doesn't understand. And just when he's feeling most lost, he thinks he sees the girl from his dreams walking down the street.
cast: Dean Kirkright, Jeremy Kewley, Christian Heath, Tamuz Ellazam

title: Swing It
des: A young man takes his grandmother to her dance class where he travels back in time to witness his grandmother when she was young. It changes his life and his perceptions of her and her generation.
cast: Rachel Noll James, Bart Johnson, Ivy Jones, Bunny Levine

title: The Future
des: When you're young and in love the future seems bright, but then what?
cast: Ben Brave, Alex Bryant-Smith, Brooke Ellen Louttit, Peter McAllum

title: Pheromone
des: When a pretty girl walks into a sleepy cafe, she changes everyone's behavior. Without her awareness, she becomes the subject of every one's private fantasy. But was she real or imagined?
cast: Josh Hammond, Alec Nemser

title: Two Summers Ago
des: Roland takes a trip with his friend Jules to visit, by surprise, his ex-girlfriend.
cast: Clara Aranovich, Andrea Caruso, Matthew Gilliam, Elizabeth Rice

title: Freshman Mushroom Project
des: Peter Lu's Freshman Mushroom Project plunges attendees into the heart of a discomforting, autobiograpical live performance that examines sexuality.
cast: Michael Q. Schmidt, Laura Lea, Peter Lu

title: Oracle
des: A young woman is haunted by dreams of a lover's death and starts to believe that her visions are brought by owls to reveal the future.
cast: Emaline Williams, Christopher J. Young

title: Best Man
des: A drinking game on the eve of her wedding leads a bride-to-be to question who the best man really is.
cast: Hilary Dusome, Danny Barclay, Brian Lally

title: Retention
des: Michael is a quiet and introverted writer in his thirties. After the love of his life, Sarah, cheats on him, he falls into a deep spiral of memories, hallucinations and obsessions, while attempting to write a memoir about her.
cast: Matt Lewis, Melissa Loprire, Bill Watterson
